item.title: bley 2.0.0 released
item.dc:creator: Evgeni Golov
item.description:
After years of silence, hacking and procrastinating I like to present bley version 2.0.0!

This release contains no changes since the last beta. Please find the changelog since the last real release (0.1.5) below:

  • New tool (bleygraph) for creating graphs
  • Rename bley.conf to bley.conf.example in the tarball
  • Rename README to README.md
  • Disable SPF Best Guess by default
  • Use Semantic Versioning (http://semver.org/)
  • Support for SQLite
  • Support for Exim
  • Support for Twisted 12, 13 and 14
  • Support for publicsuffix.org
  • Support for systemd
  • Support for postgrey comptatible whitelist_recipients and whitelist_clients lists
  • Support for configuring the cache age
  • Improve documentation
  • Lots of PEP8 and PyFlakes fixes
  • Add tests
  • Add example logcheck filter rules

item.title: bley 2.0.0-beta.2 released
item.dc:creator: Evgeni Golov
item.description: Here we are, another beta release on the way to 2.0.0. Mostly cosmetics in this one, I hope to get the final out with the next release. Please test this and report if you find any issues.

item.title: bley 2.0.0-beta.1 released
item.dc:creator: Evgeni Golov
item.description: After only three years, I have finally released bley 2.0.0-beta.1, the first milestone to bley 2.0.0. Yes, this is a huge version jump, mostly because the 0.1.x series was more like a 1.0 series and semantic versioning suggests do increase the major digit when doing incompatible changes (updated DB layout, new command line switches, etc). Please test this and report if you find any issues.

item.title: bley 0.1.5 released
item.dc:creator: Evgeni Golov
item.description: I've just released bley 0.1.5! This release includes another MySQL fix (people, really, use PostgreSQL!), a manpage and now properly detects UsEr@EXamPLe.cOM as user@example.com.

item.title: bley 0.1.4 released
item.dc:creator: Evgeni Golov
item.description: I've just released bley 0.1.4! It includes two small fixes that should make it even more stable (1: reconnect to a dead database, 2: strip non-ascii chars).

item.title: bley 0.1.2 released
item.dc:creator: Evgeni Golov
item.description: I've just released bley 0.1.2! 0.1.1 behaved wrongly in some setups in regard to RBLs (twisted-names is needed again).

item.title: bley 0.1.1 accepted to Debian
item.dc:creator: Evgeni Golov
item.description:
Today, bley was accepted to Debian.
If you are running unstable (sid), you now can "apt-get install bley" and enjoy! Ubuntu Maverick should follow soon, and I hope to be able to provide backports for Lenny and older Ubuntus too.

item.title: bley 0.1.1 uploaded to Debian
item.dc:creator: Evgeni Golov
item.description:
Uploading to ftp-master (via ftp to ftp.upload.debian.org):
Uploading bley_0.1.1-1.dsc: done.
Uploading bley_0.1.1.orig.tar.gz: done.
Uploading bley_0.1.1-1.debian.tar.gz: done.
Uploading bley_0.1.1-1_all.deb: done.
Uploading bley_0.1.1-1_amd64.changes: done.
This means: bley was just uploaded to Debian. It's currently in the NEW queue, but I hope it will hit the archive very soon :)
I'll post the .deb under download in a couple of minutes.

item.title: bley 0.1.1 released
item.dc:creator: Evgeni Golov
item.description: I've just released bley 0.1.1! 0.1 had severe problems with MySQL.
